resources.string: Allows you to perform basic and mathematical operations such as modulus, square root, cube root, trigonometric, exponential, logarithmic, hyperbolic functions etc.

• Be sure to press [C] while starting new calculation.
 • Try to use brackets when working with complex calculation.
 • Predefined operations such as Pi, log, Exp, roots, powers are available to save your time.
 • Use memory functions to calculate cumulative totals
 	MC : Clears the memory
 	MR : Recall value in memory
 	MS : Save value in memory
 	M+ : Adds currently displayed number on your calculator to the number in memory
 	M- : Subtracts currently displayed number on your calculator to the number in memory 
 • Before performing any trigonometric operation, do check the unit of angle ie Deg or Rad.
 	Note: By default angle unit is set to Degree
\u2022 Perform multiple operations without brackets. \n \u2022 Leave parenthesis unmatched\n
\u2022 Keyboard operation is disabled.\n \u2022 Supports inputs upto 9 digits. \n
